docs.snippet: Twenty-one points clear at the top of the league with 85 goals scored in 25 games and a goal difference of 63, Austrian Bundesliga leaders Salzburg are making strong claims to being the most dominant team in Europe....
docs.lead_paragraph: Twenty-one points clear at the top of the league with 85 goals scored in 25 games and a goal difference of 63, Austrian Bundesliga leaders Salzburg are making strong claims to being the most dominant team in Europe.

headline.main: Salzburg Take the Art of Pressing to New Level
headline.print_headline: Salzburg Take the Art of Pressing to New Level

docs.snippet: Bayern Munich president Uli Hoeness, once one of Germany's most admired football managers, goes on trial on Monday charged with tax evasion in a case that has shocked the nation and changed attitudes towards paying taxes....
docs.lead_paragraph: Bayern Munich president Uli Hoeness, once one of Germany's most admired football managers, goes on trial on Monday charged with tax evasion in a case that has shocked the nation and changed attitudes towards paying taxes.

headline.main: Bayern Chief Hoeness to Go on Trial on Tax Evasion Charges

docs.snippet: Daniele De Rossi is out of the game at Napoli on Sunday after AS Roma's appeal against his three-match ban for punching Inter Milan's Mauro Icardi last week was rejected by the Italian Football Federation (FIGC)....
docs.lead_paragraph: Daniele De Rossi is out of the game at Napoli on Sunday after AS Roma's appeal against his three-match ban for punching Inter Milan's Mauro Icardi last week was rejected by the Italian Football Federation (FIGC).

headline.main: De Rossi Misses Roma Trip to Napoli After Appeal Rejected

docs.snippet: Ukraine's Premier League will kick off again on March 15 despite the political turmoil in the country that has put the championship on hold since the winter break, the football federation (FFU) said on Friday....

headline.main: Ukraine League to Resume Next Weekend Despite Crisis

docs.snippet: Former Brazil midfielder Arouca called for tough action against racists on Friday after a spectator abused him with monkey calls and insults following his starring performance in Santos's 5-2 win over Mogi Mirim in a Paulista state championship ma...
docs.lead_paragraph: Former Brazil midfielder Arouca called for tough action against racists on Friday after a spectator abused him with monkey calls and insults following his starring performance in Santos's 5-2 win over Mogi Mirim in a Paulista state championship match.

headline.main: Arouca Urges Brazil to Get Tough on Racism
headline.print_headline: Arouca Urges Brazil to Get Tough on Racism

docs.snippet: Former NFL player Darren Sharper, facing California charges of drugging and raping two women, will not immediately be sent to Louisiana where he is wanted on suspicion of rape in a separate incident, a judge ruled on Friday in an extradition heari...
docs.lead_paragraph: Former NFL player Darren Sharper, facing California charges of drugging and raping two women, will not immediately be sent to Louisiana where he is wanted on suspicion of rape in a separate incident, a judge ruled on Friday in an extradition hearing.

headline.main: Ex-NFL Player Wanted for Rape Will Stay in California for Now
headline.print_headline: Ex-NFL Player Wanted for Rape Will Stay in California for Now

docs.snippet: The U.S. women's soccer team's two-year unbeaten streak ended at 43 games Friday with a 1-0 loss to Sweden and former coach Pia Sundhage at the Algarve Cup in Albufiera, Portugal....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. women's soccer team's two-year unbeaten streak ended at 43 games Friday with a 1-0 loss to Sweden and former coach Pia Sundhage at the Algarve Cup in Albufiera, Portugal.

headline.main: Sweden Beats US 1-0, Ends 43-Game Unbeaten Streak
headline.print_headline: Sweden Beats US 1-0, Ends 43-Game Unbeaten Streak

docs.snippet: Los Angeles Angels lefty Hector Santiago kept up his push for a starting spot, pitching four shutout innings Friday in a 3-2 loss to the Chicago Cubs in a split-squad game....
docs.lead_paragraph: Los Angeles Angels lefty Hector Santiago kept up his push for a starting spot, pitching four shutout innings Friday in a 3-2 loss to the Chicago Cubs in a split-squad game.
